title: Ex-Employees of the Former Government of East Pakistan (Appointment to Federal Posts) Ordinance, 1983.
title_en: Ex-Employees of the Former Government of East Pakistan (Appointment to Federal Posts) Ordinance, 1983.
description: Official consolidated text of Ex-Employees of the Former Government of East Pakistan (Appointment to Federal Posts) Ordinance, 1983. (XI of 1983) published by The Pakistan Code (Service Laws).

provisions.title: Section 5. Pension
provisions.content:
PAKISTAN (APPOINTMENT TO FEDERAL POSTS) ORDINANCE, 1983
ORDINANCE No. XI OF 1983
[25th May, 1983]
An Ordinance to provide for the appointment of former employees of the Government of East
Pakistan to posts under the Federal Government.
WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the appointment of former employees of the
Government of East Pakistan to posts under the Federal Government;
AND WHEREAS the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render it necessary to
take immediate action;
NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the fifth day of July 1977, and in
exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate
the following Ordinance:___

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
_ (1) This Ordinance may be called the
Ex-Employees of the former Government of East Pakistan (Appointment to Federal Posts)
Ordinance, 1983.
(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.
(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the sixteenth
day of December, 1971.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or
provisions.content:
context,__
(a)     “employee” means an employee of the former Government of East Pakistan
who was repatriated or who migrated from East Pakistan to Pakistan during
the period commencing on the 16th December, 1971, and ending on the 31st
December, 1974, in consequence of occupation of the territory by enemy
troops or establishment of Bangladesh ;
(b)     “former post” means the post which was held by an employee at the time of
his repatriation or migration to Pakistan;
(c)     “Grade” means the Grade of the National Pay Scale in which a post or group
of posts is placed; and
(d)     “post” means a post in an All-Pakistan Service or a service of the Federation
or a post in connection with the affairs of the Federation.

provisions.title: Section 3. Appointment. An employee may, with the approval of the competent Authority, be
provisions.content:
appointed to an existing or supernumerary post in the Grade, as far as practicable, equivalent to the
scale of the former post of such employee from the date he holds such post.
Explanation.___ In this section, “competent authority”, in relation to a post, means the
authority competent under the Civil Servants Act, 1973 (LXXI of 1973), to make appointment to that
post.

provisions.title: Section 4. Seniority. The service rendered under the former Government of East Pakistan by an
provisions.content:
employee shall count towards seniority in the Grade of the post to which he may be appointed under
section 3.

definitions.definition: an employee of the former Government of East Pakistan who was repatriated or who migrated from East Pakistan to Pakistan during the period commencing on the 16th December, 1971, and ending on the 31st December, 1974, in consequence of occupation of the territory by enemy troops or establishment of Bangladesh ;
the post which was held by an employee at the time of his repatriation or migration to Pakistan;
the Grade of the National Pay Scale in which a post or group of posts is placed; and
a post in an All-Pakistan Service or a service of the Federation or a post in connection with the affairs of the Federation.
